title: Georgia vs. Notre Dame: How to watch on TV and what you need to know
text:
Irish vs. Bulldogs is the prime time feature, but there’s at least one top-notch matchup slated for each time slot of the day. Check out the TV schedule and picks of the best games to watch. (Read more)

We’ll also run down the biggest takeaways from Week 4, starting with Michigan at Wisconsin to lead the noon kickoffs and updating throughout the day. (Read more)

More college football coverage from The Post:

Gus Malzahn rides a perpetual seesaw into Auburn-Texas A&M game

Tulane’s fake kneel-down and last-second win is the college football ending of the year

A ‘College GameDay’ sign asked for beer money. It sparked a children’s hospital fundraiser.

Barry Svrluga: NCAA should hear state lawmakers’ message on amateurism instead of fighting it

John Feinstein: College football is better with Les Miles coaching. He could be ... running for president?

Ralph Friedgen, back in fold with Maryland, will be honored during Penn State game
description: Get ready for the prime time clash between the No. 7 Fighting Irish and No. 3 Bulldogs, then follow for updates during the game.
authors: Reporter Covering University Of Maryland Athletics
